thread.title: Danny Dyer was calmed down by EastEnders co-stars during 'drunken meltdown' after NTAs
thread.title_full: Danny Dyer was calmed down by EastEnders co-stars during 'drunken meltdown' after NTAs

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Danny Dyer was calmed down by EastEnders co-stars during 'drunken meltdown' after NTAs
text:
Danny Dyer is taking a break from filming (Photo: BBC) Share Get soaps   
Danny Dyer was calmed down by his EastEnders co-stars as he allegedly had a meltdown following the National Television Awards. 
The actor - who is currently taking a "short break" from the BBC soap amid reports he is suffering from exhaustion - is said to have "kicked off" following the ceremony, and the moment was captured on film. 
In footage published by The Sun Online, Danny can be seen with his cast mates stepping in to "rally round" him during the dramatic incident. Danny with co-star Lacey Turner at the NTAs last month (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Read More Danny Dyer's concerned mum 'begged Alan Carr not to let him get drunk' on chat show 
"You could tell Danny had been drinking. The whole thing lasted about 15 minutes," an onlooker told the publication. 
Another added: "The actors got together as a group to rally round Danny. It was like they were thinking, ‘S**t we’ve got to calm him down’ because he was really kicking off. 
“It was obvious he was going off on one. He was really animated. His partner was also trying to calm him at one stage as well.” 
The footage appears to show the star being comforted by friends including Laurie Brett and James Bye, with the latter wrapping an arm around his pal. 
Meanwhile, Danny's wife Joanne Mas can also be seen in the video attempting to calm him down. 
A source added that he'd been taking photos with fans and meeting some of the crowd before the incident. Read More EastEnders star Danny Dyer flies to South Africa after being given break from BBC soap Danny has starred as Mick Carter since 2013 (Photo: BBC) 
The Sun on Sunday reported that he had taken time off after clashing with cast and crew, but a show spokeswoman said there is "absolutely no truth in any of these allegations" . 
She said: "Danny is always a consummate professional. Danny has never walked off set, nor has he ever lost his temper or been rude to anyone at work. 
"Danny is an extremely popular member of cast and respected by everyone on the show." 
Dyer, who has played Mick Carter since 2013, supped a couple of beers on the long haul flight with onlookers saying he looked tired. 
He has vowed to properly rest for the sake of his family. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
